contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|inspiration|inspirational|inspire}} {{Wikiquote|inspiration}} '''Inspiration''' or '''Inspire''' may refer to: * [[Artistic inspiration]], sudden creativity in artistic production * [[Biblical inspiration]], the doctrine in Judeo-Christian theology concerned with the divine origin of the Bible * Creative inspiration, sudden creativity when a new [[invention]] is created * [[Inhalation]], the movement of air into the lungs, breathing in {{tocright}} ==Automobiles== * [[Honda Inspire]], a luxury sedan introduced by Honda in 1990 * [[Inspiration (car)]], a British-designed and built steam-propelled car designed by Glynne Bowsher == Business == * [[BT Inspiration]], a telephone switchboard * ''[[Carnival Inspiration]]'', a Fantasy-class cruise ship operated by Carnival Cruise Line * Inspiration [[Rebreather#CCR|CCR]], a make of scuba-diving rebreather * [[Inspiration (computer program)]], a visual learning software tool published by Inspiration Software * [[The Inspiration Network]], a worldwide family and religious cable-television network * [[Inspire (fragrance)]], a fragrance by Christina Aguilera == Film == * [[Inspiration (1915 film)|''Inspiration'' (1915 film)]], a 1915 film starring Audrey Munson * [[Inspiration (1931 film)|''Inspiration'' (1931 film)]], a 1931 film starring Greta Garbo * [[Inspirations (film)|''Inspirations'' (film)]], a 1997 film directed by Michael Apted == Other== * INSPIRE stands for [[Infrastructure for Spatial Information in the European Community]] * [[Inspiration (racehorse)]], a Hong Kong based Thoroughbred racehorse * [[Inspiration (sculpture)|''Inspiration'' (sculpture)]], a 2010 public artwork by American artist Ethan Kerber * [[Inspiration FM]], a community radio station in Northampton, United Kingdom == Literature == * [[Inspirational fiction]] * [[Inspire (magazine)|''Inspire'' (magazine)]], an online magazine published by the terrorist organization al-Qaeda * Inspire – a quarterly newsletter published by Australian intellectual property firm, [[Phillips Ormonde Fitzpatrick]] == Music == * [[Inspirational music]], a music genre * [[The Inspirations]], Southern Gospel group * Inspiration Records, record label of [[The Inspirations]] * [[Inspire (song)|"Inspire" (song)]], a 2004 song by Ayumi Hamasaki ===Albums=== * ''[[The Inspiration]]'', a 2006 album by Young Jeezy * [[Inspiration (Aziza Mustafa Zadeh album)|''Inspiration'' (Aziza Mustafa Zadeh album)]], a 2000 album by Aziza Mustafa Zadeh * [[Inspire (Jack Vidgen album)|''Inspire'' (Jack Vidgen album)]], second studio album by Jack Vidgen * [[Inspiration (Cathy Dennis album)|''Inspiration'' (Cathy Dennis album)]], a 1993 album by Cathy Dennis * [[Inspiration (Elkie Brooks album)|''Inspiration'' (Elkie Brooks album)]], a 1989 album by Elkie Brooks * [[Inspiration (Maze album)|''Inspiration'' (Maze album)]], a 1979 album by Maze * [[Inspiration (Shinhwa album)|''Inspiration'' (Shinhwa album)]], a 2006 album by Shinhwa * [[Inspiration (William Hung album)|''Inspiration'' (William Hung album)]], a 2004 album by William Hung * [[Inspiration (Yngwie Malmsteen album)|''Inspiration'' (Yngwie Malmsteen album)]], a 1996 album by Yngwie Malmsteen * [[Inspire (Casiopea album)|''Inspire'' (Casiopea album)]], 2002 ==See also== * [[Muse]] {{disambiguation}} [[de:Inspiration]] [[ru:Вдохновение]]
